body:
This is a tricky one: We need to include the repo mapping entries we applied to each extension's `attr.label` tag attributes into the extension's usages hash.

@meteorcloudy @Wyverald Should this block 7.5.0 as well?

issue.title: [8.1.0] Lockfile fails to be regenerated when `use_repo_rule` statements are added

milestone.title: 8.1.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.1.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.title: Record repo mapping entries for labels in module extension tags

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
The mapping of an apparent name in a module extension tag's `attr.label` attribute to the corresponding canonical name has to be recorded in the lockfile so that instantiated repo rules don't reference the stale repos.

Fixes #25063

body:
> Should this block 7.5.0 as well?

Yes, I believe it's better to fix this also in 7.5.0
